channel.title: Obamas getting owned
channel.description:
Debates are on, I've never been so sure about Romney god damn... He is cutting through Obama like butter
I wasn't even that interested this election either

item.title: Obamas getting owned
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:73, topic:463001”]Holy fuck $23? No wonder business has such a hard time operating there and they need to hike up prices.

When you raise the minimum wage you raise the cost of living, it doesn’t do much in the end.[/quote]
Still the unemployment rate is lower here than in United States (The same applies to Switzerland). The biggest issues for Norwegian companies is the falling value of the US dollar.

EDIT: The ratio between minimum wage and living costs are higher here than in US. So you get much more for a Norwegian minimum wage than an American minimum wage. However, the median wage in US gives more stuff than the Norwegian median wage.

So in America, the poor are poorer and the rich are richer.

Read full topic

item.title: Obamas getting owned
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Here the minimum wage is around $23 if you work at a retail store. (There isn’t a minimum wage like in US/Canada, but I shall not go into the legal stuff.) So it isn’t weird that everything is much more expensive than in Canada.

“Branded” cereal is always more expensive.

Read full topic

item.title: Obamas getting owned
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

We’ve got decent wages. Minimum wage is $10.25 So in comparison, everything is more expensive than usa, but cheaper than norway and switzerland. Going shopping in the USA is awesome as a Canadian though.

Man I look back to being a kid, when gasoline was $0.50 a litre(now $1.30), all food was 2-4x cheaper. I remember my mom wouldnt buy lucky charms cereal because they cost $3, and when on sale she’d get some. Now cereal boxes are smaller and cost nearly $7. This is mostly normal since back than minimum wage was about 6$/hr, so low end wages have increased but it still doesnt match the price increases.

But it seems to me that $20/hr jobs remain $20/hr jobs - what used to be considered good is not good anymore, for the same job. (biased to my small town location where there is really only labour jobs)

Our generation is really getting the shit end of things it seems

Read full topic

item.title: Obamas getting owned
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

“With this, they were able to hire 5 more of my friends. Although now looking at it, maybe that would cost 5 jobs from the competition This is why I’m not into economics.”
And this is why I think economics are flawed, it is more chaotic than a PRNG.

Norway and Switzerland has some of the highest wages in the world, but everything cost 1.6/1.7 times the cost in US (On average). So while the economy and wages increases, we doesn’t get anything back for it (Unless you buy stuff of the internet). Our government need to limit their spending to prevent the currency of getting too strong.

So the poor and the middle class in US are stuck in their situation, as their wages doesn’t increase compared to the price level.

Read full topic

item.title: Obamas getting owned
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Bowser jr:

Frell: Do you have any good idea on what the terms should be?

Well,

Perhaps every penny must go towards job creation or wage increases (for lower wage workers but Im not going to say what is considered low)

Or, maybe investing in something else that would lead to job creation. For example my friends run a green energy company and they do geo thermal drilling and solar panels. They just purchased a new drill that is superior to the local competition. With this, they were able to hire 5 more of my friends. Although now looking at it, maybe that would cost 5 jobs from the competition This is why im not into economics

Hate to keep bringing up Canada, but this is the problem with Harper. he is completely opposed to having terms with these tax cuts despite the fact that their sole intention is job creation. It just doesnt make sense unless he really is a puppet for the rich.

Read full topic

item.title: Obamas getting owned
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:44, topic:463001”][quote author=Pompano21 link=topic=566272.msg4118848#msg4118848 date=1349446637]
I would be worried to see Romney as president tbh.
[/quote]
You shouldn’t be, hes a republican but he comes without the common republican foreign policies which is a good thing.[/quote]
How is that a good thing? His statements regarding Palestinians is in complete contradiction to his party’s common principle of having two democratic states – Israel and Palestine.

His comments regarding the protests in Libya and Egypt was also seen negatively by the American public:

Pew Research Center for the People and the Press – 17 Sep 12

Middle East Turmoil Closely Followed; Romney’s Comments Viewed Negatively

Overview About four-in-ten Americans (43%) have followed news about the attacks on U.S. embassies in the Middle East and the killing of an American ambassador

Read full topic

item.title: Obamas getting owned
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

jme:

Frell, if a small business needs more workers but can’t afford them, than absolutely this would help! I just think this needs to be regulated more. If you don’t use it on employees, you don’t get the savings. Issue fixed

Pretty much this. There needs to be terms with the tax cuts.

Read full topic

item.title: Obamas getting owned
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I watched this with my own country already. Harper put his faith in tax cuts, and over the last year the unemployment rate has not moved. The labour force increased by 185,000 people but only added 176,000 jobs. Population growth was 1.2%, but employment grew only 1%. There are 72,000 less youth employed than this time last year (and note that we are a small populated country). Investment in factories etc has decreased while stock piles of money have increased. Harper has admitted they aren’t working, he keeps “urging” businesses to start using the savings on their workers (since they haven’t been) and is complaining that they are stock piling money. Harpers solution? We need even more cuts next year! Fuck me.

Another problem that should be considered, is that a business can substantially reduce their employee’s and will still receive tax cuts.

Frell, if a small business needs more workers but can’t afford them, than absolutely this would help! I just think this needs to be regulated more. If you don’t use it on employees, you don’t get the savings. Issue fixed

edit: And on topic to the debate, Romney said he has no clue what tax break you get for shipping jobs overseas. I wished Obama would word this better. If you move your business overseas you can claim it as a business expense like any other business expense. This should honestly be stopped. As if the cheap labour wasn’t an incentive enough that they can practically move there for free! Romney plays stupid but knows exactly what Obama was saying.

Read full topic

item.title: Obamas getting owned
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Bowser jr:

Let say you are poor and you have no education except high school. How are you going to climb out of it?

TEMPORARY government assistance for a loan to get further education.

jme:

The argument that tax cuts will create jobs is an idea based on faith and not science.

In big corporations that is somewhat true. The goal is to make it easy for small business to grow with less taxes and less regulations.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Against, wont work in capitalism. Itll basically be slavery.

This is why we don’t like illegal immigrants, and “they took our jobs” is misunderstood. Illegal immigrants go under the radar and work for less than minimum wage, so they’re the obvious pick if a business can get away with it.

item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

If Chinese workers were given a fair wage, an iPhone would only cost 20% more.

item.title: Obamas getting owned
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:53, topic:463001”][quote author=Frell link=topic=566272.msg4118893#msg4118893 date=1349451037]
Bringing the jobs over to America would just make the final product cost even more.[/quote]

which isn’t a bad thing at all[/quote]
It would cost more in general to operate too. They pay the people in china what, .50 an hour? If they were forced to pay them $7 an hour and manufacture at the same rate here in America the price of an iphone would be $3000 lol

Niall:

manufacturing isn’t a quality job but retail for example is?

Not when your only job is to sit there and screw the back and front plate together.

Bowser jr:

Any form of effectivization would only hurt the workers, that is the big problem with capitalism. If you want more jobs, you must accept higher prices.

And in the end nothing changes. The poor would have jobs and money but they would still be poor because the value of everything else went up along with their income.

If china implemented a minimum wage system think what would happen…

Read full topic
